ratings.comment: Lashed out after we didn't watch the movie we were assigned (there was no way to watch it other than "figure it out"). Lenient grader, 2 exams (in-class essays), 4 2-page papers, mock trial, artistic performance final. Extremely knowledgable. Do not take class if you don't like the Bible/Torah. LOTS of reading. He is a little bit scary.

He's very accommodating and gives detailed feedback. Class isn't too challenging and he grades easily, but you really do have to do the readings. I would reccommend him if you have a background/interest in the subject, if not then no. You can tell he's very enthusiastic about what he researches and he can get upset if people aren't interested.
Extremely rude and unprofessional. He refused to give me academic support when I asked. Had to report him to his department. Hope he can't teach for much longer

Genuinely just rude and overly uptight. He threw a tantrum twice that not enough people were raising their hands to discuss the hours of assigned readings per night so he sent everyone home 15 min into class. Massive waste of everyone's time. Did a pop quiz in place of an attendance sheet randomly because his feelings were hurt again.

This was my fav class all semester. I highly recommend Prof Hutton he is very enthusiastic about Egypt and his lectures are interesting! There is a lot of reading its important to do them to do well in the class. I knew absolutely nothing about Egypt before this class and got 100 on the first exam. If you study and go to lecture, you will do well!
Professor Hutton was enthusiastic, engaging and created some of the most thought provoking discussions I've had in lecture. He is kind, accessible and challenges students in the best way.

Professor Hutton was one of the best professors I've had. He really cared about students and their needs and was flexible. His main goal was learning. For a four credit class, the workload was very doable. A background in religious studies would be helpful, but not necessary for understanding content. Definitely recommend taking a course under him!

Grade is almost entirely dependent on writing. If you don't like to write, don't take this class. I find the word count requirements to be excessive for the complexity of the questions asked, but anyone who is super into the topic/writing might find it easier. Professor accepts late work and doesn't seem to take any points of as far as I can tell.
This was by far my favorite class this semester, this is the only professor where after the class ended I sought out what he'd be teaching next.

Jeremy is your classic Egypt history buff/lover. Very enthusiastic about the subject material which is nice. Seems more like my older nerdy cousin than an actual professor, which I could be good or bad depending on your outlook. Class itself was very easy, sometimes lectures were disorganized, but we worked through it fine. All in all, not too bad.

Professor Hutton is an amazing teacher! Really easy class and also super interesting topics. You can tell he is passionate with his teachings and has a great sense of humor. I absolutely LOVED his class. We did not receive a final exam, and there were only two midterms with three small essays. No hw, just readings. Come to class and he covers it.

If you don't have a background in the old testament, good luck. I do, but others will have a tough time because the professor presents it in a way like you already do. Class is kind of dry. Tests are short answers and there are a couple papers. Just read the Bible passages, take good notes, and go to discussion and you'll be alright.
Hutton is a fantastic professor. He is very engaging and excited about the material. Makes class fun. There are a lot of readings, but he does an excellent job explaining everything.

Wonderful professor. Previous knowledge of the biblical text is helpful, but not necessary. TAs are picky in grading, but if you study for the exams how Hutton tells you, you can get an AB or higher no problem. On top of that, the class is very interesting if you are into sacred texts at all.

I'd highly discourage anyone who is not familiar with the biblical text to avoid this class. Professor treats the course more as a graduate level biblical lit course and is incomprehensible as well as the textbook(collins). In addition, TA's for the course grade very harshly in terms of the essay questions and make it extremely difficult to earn As

Great professor. Very knowledgable about biblical literature. Lectures can get boring but he throws in a funny joke or two every once in a while. No need to read the book if you attend lectures and take notes. Overall great guy great class
He is a fantastic teacher and such a nice person.  He is SO passionate about the subject it makes it interesting to listen to.  I highly recommend him.

He is such an intelligent man, and he truly wants you to do well in his class (i.e., giving you all the essay questions in advanced) and is so helpful if you just go to him after class. Yes, it can be pretty dry, but so is the material and he does a good job at describing everything you need to know. Just go to lecture, and reading isn't necessary!

ok class. questions are given ahead of time but a lot of reading is involved to do well on the course. TA's are very specific on what constitutes an A exam so be prepare to be write very thorough responses
Really smart guy, knows a ton about biblical literature! Lectures are kind of hard to follow but exams are pretty easy and the questions were given to us ahead of time.
